clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Meal Delivery Services Designed to Improve Diabetic Blood Sugar Control
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Meal Delivery Services Designed to Improve Diabetic Blood Sugar Control

brief_summary.textblock: We will conduct a randomized controlled trial study to measure the impact of medically tailored meal delivery by Meals on Wheels (MoW) volunteers or employees to individuals with poorly controlled diabetes (intervention) vs. individuals with poorly controlled diabetes currently on the MoW interest list that have not yet received services (control). Individuals meeting all inclusion and no exclusion criteria will be randomized to receive medically tailored meal delivery for 6 months or remain on the MoW interest list.

detailed_description.textblock:
We are partnering with Meals on Wheels (MoW) of Austin to provide the meals and delivery service for this study. Everything MoW does will be routine for the organization. UT research personnel will provide informed consent and collect all study measures. Participants must be willing to undergo the background check in order to participate, but they do not need to "pass" the background check to participate and receive services.
MoW will call people on the "interested" list and ask their standard new client questions related to MoW services. One of these questions includes medical conditions. If an individual states that he or she has diabetes, the MoW caseworker will notify them of the research study (see script) and ask if they would be interested in participating. If the potential participant indicates that they would be interested, MoW will contact the UT research team to call and schedule a time to obtain consent and screen the individual for enrollment.
If the participant meets enrollment qualifications they will be randomized to intervention (6 months of medically tailored meals delivered by a MoW volunteer/driver) or control (remain on the interest list and receive regular MoW services when they reach the top of the list). Participants in the treatment arm will receive 1 ready-to-eat and 1 frozen medically tailored meal delivered by MoW volunteers/drivers Monday through Friday. Individuals in the control arm will not initially receive MoW services but will remain on the MoW interest list and receive services based on the normal progression through this list.
At the end of the 6-month study period, individuals in the intervention group will receive Meals on Wheels regular services or return to their position on the interest list (names will remain on the list and move up while on intervention allowing for no loss in "place" in the line).
Main Outcome Measures - HbA1c level. We will collect HbA1c at five points in time: baseline, 3, 6, 9 and 12 months. Based on previous research we anticipate that the proposed sample size for this study will provide adequate power to detect a difference in measured HbA1c levels between 2 groups.
Secondary Outcome Measures - healthcare utilization, self-efficacy, nutritional status and food security, depression, anxiety, loneliness, resilience, health status and quality of life, self-reported disability, and satisfaction.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A randomized controlled trial of meal delivery services designed to improve diabetic blood sugar control.
study_design_info.masking_description: The research team member collecting data will be blinded to the participant randomization status.

primary_outcome.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline measurement to 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Status and Quality of Life as Assessed by the Short Form-12 Question Survey
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the Short Form-12 question survey to measure physical and mental health status. Summary scores range from 0-100, with higher scores indicating a better self-reported level of health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Loneliness as Assessed by the Scale for Measuring Loneliness in a Large Survey
secondary_outcome.description: Three item measure with a three-point response scale from 1-3, with a score of 1 indicating the least loneliness and a score of 3 indicating the most loneliness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Self-Efficacy as Assessed by the General Self-Efficacy (GSE) scale to Measure an Individual's Sense of Perceived Self-efficacy
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the General Self-efficacy Scale to measure an individual's sense of perceived self-efficacy. The total score ranges between 1 and 4, with 1 indicating low self-efficacy and 4 indicating high self-efficacy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Resilience as Assessed by the Brief Resilience Scale (BRS)
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the Brief Resilience Scale (BRS) to measure the ability of individuals to bounce back from stress. Six item scale scored from 1-5, with a score of 1 indicating low resilience and a score of 5 indicating high resilience.

secondary_outcome.measure: Social Support as Assessed by the 8-item Medical Outcomes Study Social Support Survey
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the 8-item medical outcomes study social support survey to measure social support. Scored from 1-5, and a score of 1 indicates lower levels of social support while a score of 5 indicates higher levels of social support.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression as Assessed by the 8-item Depression Health Questionnaire (PHQ-8)
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the Depression Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-8) to measure depression. Scored from 0-3, and a score of 0 indicates lower levels of depression while a score of 3 indicates higher levels of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anxiety as Assessed by the 7-item Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD-7)
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD-7) to measure anxiety. Scored from 0-3, and a score of 0 indicates lower levels of anxiety while a score of 3 indicates higher levels of anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Food Security as Assessed by the 6-item USDA Food Security Survey
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the USDA Food Security Scale to measure food security. Scored by number of affirmatives recorded, and a higher number of affirmatives recorded indicates lower food security while a lower number of affirmatives recorded indicates higher food security.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Status as Assessed by the Functional Status Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will use the Functional Status Questionnaire to measure functional status. It provides information into a patient's physical, psychological, social and role functions. The questionnaire consists of 5 sections; physical function in the activities of daily living, psychological function, role function, social function, and variety of performance measures. Each section is scored differently from a scale of 0-4 or 1-6.

arm_group.description: 1 ready-to-eat and 1 frozen medically tailored meal delivered by Meals on Wheels volunteers/drivers Monday through Friday.

participants randomized to remain on the Meals on Wheels interest list will receive regular Meals on Wheels services when they reach the top of the list (typically 4-6 months from placement on the list).

intervention.description: 6 months of medically tailored meals delivered Monday- Friday by a Meals on Wheels volunteer or driver.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of poorly controlled diabetes (confirmed by point of care HbA1C finger-stick blood test of 8.0 or higher)
- 50-85 years of age
- Living in Austin area
- Willing to be available for delivery on scheduled dates (intervention arm only)
- Lives where meal preparation is needed (i.e. not living with someone who prepares meals)
- Homebound (ADL functional impairment score >20)
- Lives in home with access to a freezer and microwave
- Able to proved informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Does not meet inclusion criteria
- Unwilling to undergo MoW background check
- Participated in MoW program in previous 6 months
- Has dementia or cognitive impairment, heart failure, cirrhosis, or current cancer diagnosis
- Is receiving hospice care
